intro: Wikstroemia fenicis, commonly known as the fragrant sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its fragrant properties make it a notable species in its native habitat, and it is often used in traditional medicine. The plant's resilience and ornamental value have contributed to its recognition in horticultural circles.
